title: Strategy Consultant, Crimson Rise  - Remote | WFH
US University Admissions Strategy Consultant
description:
About the job
New Zealand-based Edutech company Crimson Education was founded in 2013 from the idea that through personalised education, we can transform students into the world leaders of tomorrow. Since then, we have rapidly grown a mission-driven team that is dedicated to building the education system for the 22nd century. We help students aiming to achieve admission and scholarships to top universities in the US, Canada, UK, EU and beyond.

In this role you will be joining our Service Delivery Department where our main focus is on student outcomes and engagement. We welcome Strategists and Mentors from around the world and actively encourage peer learning and collaboration so that we can benefit from their diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. We pride ourselves on offering flexibility, autonomy, and innovation, and look for individuals hoping to inform change across our internal processes but also our services for students.

Strategy Consultants (Admissions Counsellors) are exemplars of Crimson Education’s philosophy dedicated to making a difference in students’ lives, helping bridge gaps between present and future goals by personalising blueprints that will become the basis of all academic, extracurricular and personal development.

You will partner closely with the student and lead the Crimson team (tutors, mentors, consultants) to drive progress through long-term roadmaps and mentoring to build their candidacy through the application processes.

This is a full-time position, that can be based remotely or in one of our many offices around the globe. We are open to Part-Time candidates (25-30+ hours) who have high-demand backgrounds. 

What success looks like:

Provide overarching admissions strategies to students by creating individualized plans and executing on them in collaboration with the rest of the students’ Crimson team (Educational Coordinators, Academic Tutors, Application Consultants, ECL Mentors)
Maintain expert knowledge of high school curricula, extracurricular and leadership choices, summer program applications, and standardized test planning to make recommendations regarding admissions strategies
Utilize in-depth knowledge of institutions of higher learning to guide students and parents towards attainable school goals, working with them to create lists of best-fit schools of varied competition to maximize acceptance chances
Conduct formal consulting sessions with students on a bi-monthly basis, chronicling and sharing with relevant stakeholders notes and action items
Maintain reasonable levels of communication with students and families outside of formal sessions through various channels (e.g. email, etc.)
Facilitate or lead development and presentation of marketing materials for seminars or expositions in local markets 
Collaborate with local Sales teams in Initial Consultations to facilitate potential client investment and understanding in Crimson’s products and services
Assist with Product and Resource Development initiatives to better our service

What skills and experience you’ll need:

 Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or Oxbridge (special considerations may be given to those with undergraduate admissions consulting backgrounds) 
Strong preference for experience with US/UK admissions consulting for the undergraduate level at top universities
Passion for coaching young adults and appreciation of global perspectives
Superior planning and organisational skills; experience in project management, event coordination, and product management a plus
Strong written and oral communication skills
Stakeholder management (collaborating with a range of internal stakeholders, students and parents)
Resilience when working independently under pressure, flexible and adaptive to working in a fast-paced growing organisation 
Experience in education, coaching, tutoring, and admissions consulting preferred

Why work for Crimson?

Be a part of the world's leading admissions consulting firm 
Rapidly growing start up, with a flexible working environment where you will be empowered to structure how you work
Limitless development and exposure - our internal promotions/role changes made up 33% of all recruitment last year
$1000 individual training budget per year, we love to ‘Level Up’ (it’s one of our core values)!
Psychologist on staff
Insightful fireside chats and workshops to help support our high-performing and ambitious team
Radical Candor is a feedback approach we live by
We’re a global player with 28 markets (and growing) across the globe. Most roles have the option to work from one of our many offices or remotely!

If you're passionate about growing in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and want to work with cutting-edge technology then we'd love to hear from you!

Please keep an eye on your spam / junk email folder for correspondence from Team Tailor.

title: Content Strategy Consultant
description:
About the job
Anthro-Tech is hiring a content strategy consultant to advise and coach clients and lead content and information architecture planning, development, and implementation. In this role, you’ll work with an interdisciplinary team of designers, researchers, accessibility experts, and change management consultants. You’ll collaborate on purposeful user-centered design solutions—from improving content usefulness, usability, accessibility, and findability, to designing entire digital experiences from the ground up. And you’ll help clients to sustain the work we do for them through content governance and measurement planning, and workshops and training. Are you getting excited?

Primary Responsibilities

 LEAD AND SUPPORT PROJECTS FROM A CONTENT AND INFORMATION ARCHITECTURE (IA) PERSPECTIVE
Identify opportunities for content based on content strategy activities—such as content audits, comparative analysis, content templates, and user research and content testing—and make actionable recommendations
Define content goals, priorities, and success metrics based on stakeholder, user, and content research
Structure and organize content for usability and findability, including designing information architectures, content models, and taxonomies
Educate clients on content strategy activities and their role in the process
 DEVELOP GOVERNANCE FOR LASTING CHANGE
Prepare clients to sustain the work we do for them through education and guidance on content governance and measurement—including roles and responsibilities and content workflow—as well as developing content guides and tools to support content governance
Collaborate with client teams, and the Anthro-Tech organizational change manager to implement proposed roles and responsibilities and content workflows 
Give and receive feedback gracefully
 CREATE HIGH-QUALITY CONTENT AND USER-CENTERED EXPERIENCES
Be familiar with popular content management systems (such as Drupal, WordPress, and SharePoint) and related content requirements
Develop content requirements for designers and developers in formats that are easy for them to understand and use
Plan for and create usable and accessible content and information architectures
User research to inform your work, including collaborating with researchers on research planning activities
Gather and act on continuous feedback from stakeholders, users, and peers throughout projects to iterate ad improve on your work
Be a fierce advocate for clear, useful, usable, and sustainable content throughout the user-centered design process

Qualifications & Attitude

4 + years of experience leading content workstreams, coaching clients, and facilitating workshops and training.
A bachelor's degree or higher in Communications, Human-Centered Design, or a related field; or equivalent relevant work experience
Experienced with content planning, writing, editing, and publishing digital content
You have developed content strategies, governance plans, and information architectures for information-rich websites
You know how to collaborate with stakeholders and work on interdisciplinary teams to accomplish shared goals
You’re ready to help scope a new project, respond to an RFP, help build our content strategy practice, and write thought leadership content
You enjoy listening to the latest Anthro-Tech crowd-sourced Spotify playlist and hearing the occasional dog and cat stories from your coworkers (or, at least be willing to humor them)

SCHEDULING & TRAVEL

This is a full-time position with the ability to work remotely or from our Olympia or Seattle, Washington offices. Occasional travel may be required.

Compensation And Benefits

Anthro-Tech offers competitive compensation and a full list of benefits, including health, vision, dental, and long-term disability insurances, 401(K) with profit sharing, training budget, and more. You’ll work in a small company environment with a talented and dedicated group of individuals that share a passion for human-centered design for social impact. General benefits information is listed below (eligibility requirements apply):

Medical insurance - Anthro-Tech pays for 90% of employee premiums and funds an initial contribution to your health savings account
Dental insurance - Anthro-Tech pays 100% of premium
Vision insurance - Anthro-Tech pays 100% of premium
Long Term Disability, AD/D, Life Insurance - Anthro-Tech pays 100% of premiums
Retirement - Our 401(k) Safe Harbor plan has no required match - we automatically make a 3% of compensation company contribution to your self-directed brokerage account. A discretionary profit-sharing component also exists.
Paid Time Off (PTO) - you'll accrue PTO for each hour you work. Full-time team members accrue approximately 15 PTO days per year
Paid Holidays - Anthro-Tech offers 9 paid holidays each calendar year which includes one floater holiday of your choice
Supplemental Pay for Parental Leave – 8 weeks of supplemental pay for parental leave is available for Washington State employees
Training & professional development - We'll work with you on a training & professional development plan each year. We're currently covering up to $2,500 in approved expenses for workshops, conferences, tuition, travel, books or other activities as well as up to 3-days paid time to attend

Actual compensation is influenced by a wide range of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and responsibility. The range of starting pay for this role of Content Strategist (Contract) is $43 - $59 per hour + Benefits.

Applications Should Include The Following

Cover letter stating your background, salary requirements, and reason for interest in working with Anthro-Tech
Resume and a short write-up describing your most significant Content Strategy engagement. We’re looking for a track record of experience and dedication.

Thank you for your interest!

About Anthro-tech

Anthro-Tech is a human-centered design consultancy focused on government agencies, nonprofits, and enterprises with a social impact mission. We help organizations gain a deep understanding of their customers through research to design products and services that are usable, useful, and make a positive impact on peoples' everyday lives.

Over the past 20 years, we’ve partnered with many organizations to transform how they engage their customers, including dozens of county, state and federal government organizations, Goodwill, Meta, The Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Anthro-Tech was founded in 1997. We are a woman-owned business with offices and user experience labs in Olympia and Seattle, Washington.

We are driven by our purpose – to build a great business that makes things better for people.

Our Values

Help others succeed
Set the bar high
Be optimistic AND face the brutal facts
Continually learn and grow expertise
Passionate about making an impact

Compensation: From $43.00 to $59.00 per hour

title: Strategy & Insights Consultant
description:
About the job
Scientific Writing and Research Consultant | SOW 

 Location: Remote 

 LOE: Dependent on Individual Task Orders 

 Timeline: June 2023 – December 2025 

 Reports to: Head of Strategic Research and Learning 

 Click here to download full RFP and SOW 

 TO PROVIDE : Scientific Writing and Research Consultant Services 

 LAST DATE FOR RECEIPT OF 

 CLARIFICATION QUESTIONS BY PSI : September 1st, 2023 

 LAST DATE FOR RESPONSES BY PSI : October 1st, 2023 

 RFP CLOSING DATE AND PLACE : October 1st, 2023 

 PROPOSALS AND CLARIFYING QUESTIONS MAY BE DELIVERED BY EMAIL TO: jwheeler@psi.org and hgill@psi.org 

 BACKGROUND 

Population Services International (PSI) is a global health and development organization working in more than 50 countries to make quality, affordable health care accessible to people where and when they need it. Out of the 7 billion people on the planet, 3.5 billion do not have access to quality essential healthcare. This inequity must change. PSI believes that health equity can only be achieved by drawing on the power of the public and private sectors and putting more control in consumers’ hands, and giving them quality affordable health care where and when they need it. PSI works with consumers, at the community level, to understand what they want and need in health resources. We then leverage our global network of 8,000 experts and our partnership in the public and private sector to fill in gaps in the markets. Join PSI’s efforts to make quality affordable health care accessible to people where and when they need it.

The Strategy & Insights (S&I) Department promotes best practice in program design, marketing discipline, research, learning, and strategy development. S&I works with other departments to systematically capture, synthesize, and share internal and external evidence, consumer and market insights, competitive market intelligence, and program experience. As part of S&I, the Strategic Research and Learning Team is accountable for establishing and advancing an organizational learning agenda, ensuring the identification and exchange of learning and insights internally, and for the implementation, use and elevation of quality, ethical research. The SR&L team is seeking a pool of Scientific Writing and Research consultants to support the organization through Indefinite Quantity Contracts (IQC) – a flexible arrangement for the provision of an indefinite amount of services within a fixed period. Individual Task Orders will be issued under the IQC which state the specific assignment, dates, and timeline.

Sound like you? Read on.

 SCOPE OF WORK 

We will be seeking consultants to provide support to some or all of these tasks as a Scientific Writing/Communication Consultant:

 Conduct tasks associated with scientific writing, such as leading rapid reviews, systematic reviews, and supporting or editing peer review manuscript submissions 
 Lead (or support) the production of professional quality research outputs 
 Develop professional quality graphics, infographics, data dashboards, or visual representations of data 

We will be seeking consultants to provide support to some or all of these tasks as a Research Consultant:

 Advanced statistical modeling and demand forecasting 
 Health systems research design 
 Econometric analysis 

 REQUESTED APPLICATION MATERIALS 

 Interested candidates should provide their cover letter and CV as well as a writing sample. 

Basic Requirements

 Master’s Degree or PhD in relevant field (e.g., implementation science, public health, anthropology, sociology, statistics, demography, epidemiology, behavioral science, economics) 
 Extensive familiarity in one or more of the following areas:
 sexual and reproductive health (experience in self-injection, safe abortion, and medical abortion preferred); 
 gender-based violence; 
 water and sanitation (experience in urban sanitation preferred); 
 malaria; 
 self-diagnostics (experience in HIV self-testing and HPV self-sampling preferred); 
 digital health; 
 health systems strengthening and health financing; and/or 
 primary health care/health services utilization. 
 Demonstrated qualifications and expertise to conduct the tasks listed under the Score of Work for each consultant type. 
 Exceptional oral and written communication skills 
 Ability to work independently 
 Excellent organizational skills and ability to independently produce deliverables 
 Ability to work across teams, time zones, and groups over whom there is no direct authority to accomplish project goals 
 Experience and excellence in working with large, multinational and intercultural teams. 
 French language skills a plus

title: Strategy Consultant - U.S. Citizenship Required
description:
About the job
Why do you need to choose between doing important work and having a fulfilling life? At Ardent, we have both. Ardent employees are committed to solving our customers' most difficult problems—and we are committed to the well-being, personal goals, and professional development of our employee. We are "All In." We put forth our strongest effort possible to get the mission accomplished and we do it together. We respect the skills and experience you bring to the Ardent team. And we provide a rewarding environment to help you succeed.

We offer highly competitive benefits, professional development opportunities, and an exceptional culture that embraces flexibility, innovation, collaboration, and career growth. A collective service mindset underpins our work, and a shared camaraderie to serve clients, colleagues and our communities set us apart. Our full commitment to being "All In" for our employees and our clients is not just our approach, it is our standard. If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, choose Ardent and make a difference with us.

Ardent is seeking a Strategy Consultant to join our team!

While this is role is primarily remote, it will require on-site client presence in Washington, DC.

Position Description:

Ardent is seeking a Strategy Consultant. This Strategy Consultant will be responsible for providing planning input (i.e. schedules, estimates, risks, status, assumptions, etc.) and producing weekly and monthly management reports. The successful candidate will participate in highly visible meetings with senior executives and political appointments at he highest levels of government, and executive debrief sessions.

Responsibilities and Duties:

The Project Manager shall be responsible for managing risks, cost, schedule, and contract scope
Ensure proper performance of tasks necessary to ensure the most efficient and effective execution of the contract
Utilize expert communication skills needed to direct the skilled consulting resources and report on deliverable progress, issues, and problem areas, as well as write and review executive memos. 
Provide navigation to the team through a fast-paced environment and provide leadership and mentoring to employees; knowing when to lean into recommendations for the overall benefit of the team and client
Build strong relationships within our client base and be able to establish open lines of communication. The Program Manager is ultimately responsible for the integrity of all work performed and all deliverables received
Responsible to work with the client in defining their business drivers and how the program objectives deliver benefits for business success
Responsible to plan and execute the funding provided by the client in order to support program requirements
Provide leadership and direction to personnel performing tasks in association with the overall program
Provide professional communications and interactions with task and functional leaders, subcontractors, and support personnel
Program Manager will have financial responsibilities to meet profitability goals established by the company
Report potential risks / issues to senior division leadership and provide recommendations for best resolution/solution

Requirements: 

Bachelor or master's degree in a policy field
Experience in public policy 
PMP strongly preferred
Ability to prioritize requirements and meet deadlines
Ability to learn and work in a fast-paced environment
At least 9 years of experience, minimum of five years managing policy/consulting projects / staff of 10 people or more
Strong Project Management skills and expert leadership skills
Effective Verbal and Written Communications Skills
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and Google suite of products
Attention to detail

Preferred Skills

Certified Project Management Professional (PMP) 
Deep understanding and experience consulting or working for/with the Federal government
Ability to prioritize requirements and meet deadlines
Ability to learn and work in a fast-paced environment

Due to the nature of the work we support, all candidates in consideration for this role must be U.S. Citizens willing to undergo the government issued background investigation process.

Ardent is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate and will take affirmative action measures to ensure against discrimination in employment, recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination, upgrading, promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job applicant on the bases of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

title: Principal Strategy Consultant, Clinical/Regulatory - Remote
description:
About the job
NAMSA pioneered the industry and was the first independent company in the world to focus solely on medical device materials for safety. NAMSA started testing medical devices before the U.S. Food and Drug Administration started regulating such products in 1976.

We are shaping the industry. NAMSA has been a key contributor to the development of the test methods that govern our industry. We have become the industry’s premier provider. We provide support for clients during every step of the product development lifecycle and beyond.

Come and work for an organization with the:

Vision to inspire innovative MedTech solutions that advance global healthcare, improve patient lives and accelerate Client success and the

Mission to deliver best-in-class global MedTech development solutions through our people, expertise and technology by adhering to our core

Values:

Act with integrity in everything we do.
Provide best-in-class customer experiences.
Develop superior talent and deliver expertise.
Respond with agility and provide timely results.
Embrace collaboration, diverse perspectives and ideas.


Job Description:

 Provide scientific technical and/or strategic, management consulting to clients in the MedTech space. Strategy Consultants at NAMSA have various depth of expertise in a product development function, including Biological Safety & Validation, Preclinical (Interventional Surgery), Device Engineering, Bench Testing, Regulatory, Clinical Research, Biostatistics, Reimbursement and/or Commercialization.
 Examples of Strategy projects include:
 Develop clinical, scientific, rationales/justifications, or regulatory strategies and lead/contribute to interactions with global regulatory agencies or other stakeholders. This could include, but is not limited to FDA, Competent Authorities, and Executive Committees/Boards at medical device manufacturers.
 Provide strategic guidance to complex medical device client needs to inform long-term planning to key stakeholders within the client’s business, including product development plans, schedule, cost, regulatory and market access requirements to be presented to Investors to assist early stage start-up medical device manufacturers with fundraising.
 Write, prepare, review, and/or edit documents to support medical device regulatory submissions or master file. This could include, but is not limited to Non-clinical Study Protocols, Q-submissions, IDE, 510(k), de novo classification requests, PMA, Clinical Development Plans, Clinical Study Reports, Investigator’s Brochure, Clinical Investigational Plan or similar technical documentation that requires strategy or technical rationales.
 Ability to speak to the cross-functional nature of MedTech product strategy and identify additional consulting or expertise needed to solve the client’s needs in an effective, expedited manner through NAMSA services.
 May serve as a key client advocate and partner (Program Director) by connecting the client to NAMSA’s extensive consulting, clinical and laboratory network.
 When supporting Program Direction Service, lead multi-disciplinary teams that may include a mix of project management, specialized consultants, client contributors and extended teams, such as laboratory study directors or clinical study managers when overseeing large NAMSA/client partnerships. This includes providing work direction, organizing, prioritizing, negotiating, and communicating relevant information to NAMSA personnel in support of clients’ strategies and budgets.
 Within NAMSA, advise senior leaders and Associates on technical, operational, educational and scientific issues related to NAMSA’s continuous improvement of service delivery.
 Coach and mentor other Associates in Strategy Services and from across the NAMSA business
 Achieve high quality and successful project completion when tasked with multiple, concurrent client relationships.
 Act with flexibility, transparency, and proactively mitigate business and project risks.
 Directly support sales and marketing by video conferencing with clients to understand client’s needs, define scope of statements of work and assist commercial team with estimated effort of the full project. Depending on area of expertise, the Strategy Consultant may be involved in scoping Clinical or Consulting and/or Laboratory services, by assisting commercial owners of opportunities.
 Build professional network within NAMSA globally to be able to advise clients on the full scope of NAMSA services and connect the optimal service area to their needs.
 Actively grow client base by demonstrating relationship success through extension of client relationships over time.
 Actively seek out new business opportunities for NAMSA services by connecting clients to extensive consulting, clinical and laboratory services.
 Publish and or speak at conferences, webinars, journals, webinars or other venues.
 Attend technical conferences, governmental or standards meetings.
 May represent NAMSA on external standards, Society or Conference Committees (e.g., AAMI, ASTM, ISO, and USP).
 Achieves substantial business value as demonstrated through effectiveness of initiating new client relationships and expanding client engagements, with minimal sales support
 Significantly contribute to the development of new NAMSA services and capabilities.


Qualifications & Technical Competencies:

 Generally, at least 15 years of relevant experience in providing strategic direction and leading a medical device product through development
 Master’s degree or doctorate in science, engineering, or business discipline strongly preferred and may qualify as years of relevant experience depending on relevance to role.
 Previous FDA/CDRH (or other Regulatory Authority) employment or relevant medical device industry experience is required.
 Previous experience in a leadership role (e.g., senior management or executive role at a medical device manufacturer, CRO, Regulatory Agency, or other related laboratory service provider) is preferred.
 Specific areas of expertise may include the following: medical device regulations, packaging/sterilization, biocompatibility, clinical and non-clinical study design, and/or engineering (e.g., root cause investigations, in vivo boundary condition development, device evaluation strategy, device design controls).
 Willing to develop in the above mentioned areas of expertise by learning from projects, the NAMSA network of experts and other self-driven professional development.
 Able to collaborate within the Strategy Consulting Team, greater NAMSA, and with the client in providing guidance and completing deliverables in a timely manner.
 Strong writing, oral, and presentation skills, including Powerpoint slide preparation.
 Solid knowledge of international business cultures
 Strong knowledge of medical research and product development business environment, particularly in the areas of global medical device requirements, regulations, data strategies, and standards (e.g. knowledge of FDA, ISO, GMP, GCP, GLP, AAMI and USP standards/guidances/regulations, major international market authorization processes such as CE mark, NMPa, PMDA etc....)
 Effective analytical and problem-solving capabilities, with the ability to translate and present complex problems to be easily understandable.
 Understanding of financial information and the impact of project financials to NAMSA’s and/or clients’ businesses.


Working Conditions:

 Ability to work in a highly matrixed team environment and handle multiple priorities and issues, foster a cooperative work environment with high quality standards, and effectively facilitate and manage meetings.
 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
 Extensive use of a computer keyboard.
 Travel approximately 5 to 20% of the time
